body:
long is 32-bits even on 64-bit windows which makes the type suboptimal
for a codebase meant to be cross-platform.

comment_data.body: as a general note I'd wait to remove casts like this just yet. We might want to support options taking 64-bit values and then these casts will still be needed.
I think it'll be easier to revert these if we decide to go with int64. I can't focus on anything with clang-tidy throwing a hissy fit.

this is not directly an option but state we parsed from an option, therefore it could have any type of our choosing (it was a mistake to make this a `long` as if it was an option in the first place, but no need to repeat the mistake), so it could just be `int *` or even `colnr_T *`

comment_data.body: Just change `cur_n` and `new_n` to `OptInt` and remove this cast

`long long` is guaranteed to be at least 64 bits, so you can just use `llabs` here and remove the cast
```suggestion
    uint64_t wd = (uint64_t)llabs(p_wd);
```
newval should also be `OptInt` or any particular reason it is still `long` ?
Just to make the minimal/fastest possible PR to unblock @famiu's work. Will address in a follow-up PR.

comment_regular_data.body: IMO `OptInt` should be typedef'd to `int64_t` rather than `int`
